ai.summary: John Ray Walk is a demanding 30.5 km hike in the United Kingdom, with the region currently listed as Unknown. Classified as hard, it tests endurance over a long distance with varied terrain and potentially changing weather.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of grassy tracks, woodland trails, muddy paths, and occasional rocky or stony sections. The route includes long stretches with little shade and noticeable elevation changes, so prepare for sustained effort and potential slip hazards in wet conditions.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a long day on foot; check weather and daylight hours; wear sturdy waterproof footwear; dress in layers with a waterproof jacket; bring a map and compass or GPS device; carry sufficient water and high-energy snacks; have a small first aid kit and whistle; tell someone your route and expected return time; be prepared for mud, livestock fencing, and uneven ground; be ready for rapidly changing UK weather.
recommended_gear: Map and compass or GPS device
Dry bags or waterproof cover for gear
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly March–September).

seo.title: John Ray Walk – 30.5 km Hard Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Tackle the 30.5 km John Ray Walk in the UK. A challenging long-distance hike (hard) with varied terrain and rewarding scenery.
